content:
In section 2.21.1.4.8 string the following sentence is given:
"An additional modifier :text can be used to specify a search with advanced text handling (see below) though only a few servers are expected to offer this facility."

Is :text really what was meant and not _text?
The reason why I am asking is because the "below" link is referring to _text. I could understand why _text is not expected to be implemented widely, but :text not so much?
Ah, see your point. Can you submit a change request?

_text is a search parameter, and is to apply to the resource as a whole (through the .text narrative in the resource)
where :text is a modifier that is to be used on Coded or reference data indicating to search based on the textual part of the property (not resource)

Yes, thanks :) But I'm pretty confident that this section was meant in reference of _text. The link in the sentence is referring to the _text section. Therefore, I guess, the specification should read that there is an additional search parameter _text, that can be used to specify a search with advanced text handling.

Please correct me if I'm wrong, but then the "below" link needs an update.
